file_content.text: Without isotope-5 fuel, we'll never get everyone off Makeb. Kind of a problem.
Careful, Uncle Shalim's in full-on politician mode.
You're taking on the entire Regulator army. Is "be careful" useful advice?
I'm no starship expert, but I doubt the ark should have that many holes in it.
Be careful in the Giant's Spear. Once a year, some idiot hiker gets killed in there.
Some "failsafe." Have to love that Hutt sense of humor.
Here's hoping Project Failsafe actually amounts to something.
Careful where you step. No telling where the ground might crack apart.
The shelter's coming down! Can we leave already?
I didn't come all this way to die! Let's go!
Follow me to safety.
Who built this--the lowest bidder?
What a worthless place!
Go, or we're dead!
Everyone for themselves!
You're on your own.
My hero!
There's never been a groundquake like that in Makeb's history. Geologic instability has increased a thousandfold since the Hutt takeover.
Seismic readings and core stability fluctuations both indicate impending catastrophe. These groundquakes are the direct result of Hutt deep core mining that's going to destroy Makeb.
When you say "destroy Makeb," I assume that means more than your tourist trade.
What kind of catastrophe?
The fireworks will be a great crowd-pleaser--but only if the crowds are in orbit.
The moment they sent the Regulators here, it was obvious the Hutts had something to hide. Now their secret's out.
No wonder they were after you.
Every scrap of data I collected here proves the Hutt Cartel's deep drilling has destabilized Makeb. These groundquakes are only the start. Entire mesas will collapse.
After that, gravitational decay will strip away the atmosphere. Kill everything. Makeb will become totally uninhabitable.
If we shut down the Cartel's mining operations, would that save Makeb?
We have to stop the mining.
It'll only slow the inevitable. We need a better solution.
There has to be a way to reverse the damage--bring stability back to this world.
We must heal Makeb.
Yes, but this isn't the place to discuss it.
If what you're saying is true, we need to get everyone off this planet right away.
We have to evacuate Makeb.
We don't have enough transports to get everyone through the atmosphere in time. We need a real solution.
So much for my vacation plans. How do we get off this rock while we can still breathe?
Let's talk escape.
I'm not writing off my homeworld--not if there's a way to stop its destruction.
I'll let Chancellor Saresh know Makeb won't be joining the Republic, after all. We didn't come here to save a dead planet.
This has been a waste of time!
I never said we were out of options!
The Cartel and its forces are on Makeb. Won't they die with everyone else?
Do the Hutts realize this?
Oh, they know what they're doing. They just don't care--and that mystifies me.
You made it! We followed Prosk's signal and... Where's Prosk?
I'm sorry. He didn't... he's gone.
Get her on a shuttle back to Shalim. The Regulators are scattered--they shouldn't give you any trouble.
Lane, escort Lemda to safety.
If they try, I... I'll shoot them all.
He gave his life saving Lemda. The best way to honor that sacrifice is by continuing the fight.
Prosk died a hero.
I know. I will.
Prosk knew the risk. This is war, and people die. The survivors carry on.
Forget about him.
Yes, Master Jedi. Of course.
Sorry, Major. You're right.
I just... nevermind.
We'll get her back to Shalim. There's a clear path back to the landing zone thanks to you.
Meet me at Uncle Shalim's office. We need to figure out a plan--fast.
Did you fall and hit your head? Not even the Hutts have the power to break a planet.
You sound like a crackpot.
I didn't know I was speaking to a fellow geophysicist. Oh, wait--I'm not!
I think there's a way to save Makeb, but I need you to work with me. I'll warn you now, I'm snappish. Everyone says so. It's not personal.
I'd say you're handling yourself just fine under the circumstances.
No need to apologize.
My family is full of politicians. They say this is my way of rebelling. Did I mention I'm the one who convinced Uncle Shalim to contact the Republic? You're welcome.
Don't apologize. You hold your own, and you're not afraid of anyone. You're my kind of woman, Lemda.
[Flirt] I like your spirit.
Every man says that, at first. Most don't mean it.
If you want help, how about thanking me for saving your life?
You still owe me for a rescue.
I also have gratitude issues. Thanks for the rescue. Oh, good, someone else to talk to....
You're... a lot more interesting than I thought.
